review: I've been meaning to write a few good words about this wonder box for some time now. It has become such an integral part of our home's entertainment system that I don't even know it's there. Tiny little black box hiding behind the TV stand and totally unobtrusive, a tiny little white LED lights up when woken up instantly on demand, I press the microphone button on the little remote control and say "Flashpoint"...and instantly the Canadian S.W.A.T. show comes up and I watch whatever episode I haven't already seen. I say, "Extant", or "Under the Dome"...they all pop up.That little box can do more. It has quad-core processing capability, several gigabytes of fast RAM. It's capable of doing pretty much anything. But as an entertainment tool, I'm actually spending more time using this little black box than with the cable box.The remote control has 7 buttons: the magic microphone button I eluded to earlier, rewind/pause/forward, back/home/settings. It's awesome, what more can I say?
